properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 1 at 7:54PM MST until February 4 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A winter storm system will bring increasing chances of snow on
Sunday night and Monday. Snow amounts greater than 6 inches will
be possible over parts of northeastern Wyoming and the higher
elevations of the Black Hills. At this time, the highest snow
totals are expected over southern Campbell County and over the
northern Black Hills.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches.

* WHERE...Southern Campbell County.

* WHEN...From 8 PM Sunday to midnight MST Monday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions
could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather
conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT MST MONDAY NIGHT
